channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Book Review: My Value Creation Journey
item.description: Bartley J. Madden has produced a book that challenges business leaders and investment professionals to think outside the box systematically to solve difficult problems.

item.title: A rivalry that predates the Civil War is about to heat up with a vote on subsidizing a new stadium
item.description: The Kansas Legislature's top leaders endorsed helping the Chiefs and professional baseball's Kansas City Royals finance new stadiums in Kansas ahead of a special session set to convene Tuesday.

item.title: Private Markets’ Governance: A New Era
item.description: Now that the SEC Private Fund Adviser rules have been struck down, it's incumbent on the industry to demonstrate how private ordering can work.

item.title: A rare flesh-eating bacteria with a 'terrifying' mortality rate that can kill people in 48 hours is spreading in Japan
item.description: “As soon as a patient notices swelling in foot in the morning, it can expand to the knee by noon, and they can die within 48 hours.”

item.title: The Interplay Between Cap Rates and Interest Rates
item.description: What is the relationship between cap rates and interest rates? It's not as straightforward as you may think.

item.title: Meet the co-owner of the NBA's Dallas Mavericks: A casino mogul trying to bring gambling to a reluctant state
item.description: “The NBA is a multifaceted business. It’s a media business, a hospitality business and a culinary business. It’s all about experience."

item.title: Still Misperceived? A Fresh Look at Bitcoin Volatility
item.description: Is Bitcoin considerably more volatile than other asset classes? It's important to approach this question analytically and with an open mind because perceptions do not always match reality.

item.title: Colliding hot and cold fronts whipsaw the U.S. with extreme heat, flooding, and a chance of snow
item.description: While most of the country bakes, parts of Montana have been placed under winter storm watches with a potential for wet snow Monday night.

item.title: FX Bubbles: Through the Lens of Shiller and Sornette
item.description: The theories and models introduced by Robert Shiller and Didier Sornette are as applicable to the foreign exchange market as they are to the stock market.

item.title: U.S. debt could threaten the economic growth that's needed to keep the burden sustainable, former IMF official says
item.description: "Even absent this dire scenario, meeting additional interest obligations as the debt ratio rises could require the federal government to cut discretionary spending, with negative implications for economic growth."
